pageContext.description: Punched ornament on faces partly rubbed away; lines near butt, cursive chevrons down blade, lateral chevrons incised to edge of very slight flanges due to hammering of sides.
pageContext.collection: Lieut. Colonel John Jardine, Chamber Crescent South. The Park, Nottingham (1927),Given in 1927 to the Castle Museum, Nottingham,27-80
pageContext.site: England, nottingham,colwick (e. of nottingham),dredged from bed of river trent,1926
pageContext.remarks: Spearhead (Cl. II) and cruched socketed celt in same collection, + large spear-head (Cl. IIIA) in Nottingham Art Museum, came from river bed at Colwick.
